sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"特殊的，特别的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: special, especial, specific, particular, exceptional, extraordinary, peculiar
means: special ： 普通用词，指不同于一般、与众不同，着重事物的专门性，突出与一般不同。
especial和special含义很接近，较正式，但侧重有特殊的意义或重要性。
specific ： 着重指某种、某类事物具有的特殊或特定的属性，也可指专门提出作特别考虑的事物。
particular ： 侧重不同于普遍性的个性或特殊性。
exceptional ： 指不同于一般，本身是特别的或异常的事物。
extraordinary ： 语气比exceptional强，指极大地超过一般或正常情况。
peculiar ： 强调指与众不同或独特的意思。

sentence.Network_en: Carpe diem. Seize the day, boys. Make your lives extraordinary.
sentence.Network_cn: 人生就应该是快乐的，要抓住每一天，孩子们，让你们的生活变得非凡起来。

sentence.Network_en: They testify to the extraordinary potency of his personality.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些事情证明了他非凡的人格魅力。

sentence.Network_en: She was a woman with extraordinary vibrancy and extraordinary knowledge.
sentence.Network_cn: 她是一位充满活力、博学多识的女子。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin extraordinarius, from extra ordinem 'outside the normal course of events'

entry.def: If you describe something or someone as extraordinary, you mean that they have some extremely good or special quality.

example.ex: We've made extraordinary progress as a society in that regard...
example.tran: 在那个方面，我们的社会已经取得了巨大的进步。

example.ex: The task requires extraordinary patience and endurance...
example.tran: 那项任务需要非凡的耐心和毅力。

entry.tran: 非常奇特的;令人惊奇的
entry.def: If you describe something as extraordinary, you mean that it is very unusual or surprising.

example.ex: What an extraordinary thing to happen!...
His decision to hold talks is extraordinary because it could mean the real end of the war.
example.tran: 他作出举行谈判的决定非同寻常，因为这可能意味着战争真的要结束了。

entry.def: An extraordinary meeting is arranged specially to deal with a particular situation or problem, rather than happening regularly.

example.ex: ...at an extraordinary meeting of the sport's ruling body...
example.tran: 在体育运动管理机构的特别会议上

example.ex: Representatives of the colonies met in an extraordinary congress.
example.tran: 各殖民地代表在一次特别大会上会面。

means.word_mean: 1. beyond what is ordinary or usual; highly unusual or exceptional or remarkable;
2. far more than usual or expected;
3. (of an official) serving an unusual or special function in addition to those of the regular officials;

auth_sentence.content: To have discovered this huge timber shipway was extraordinary.
auth_sentence.res_content: To have discovered this huge timber shipway was extraordinary.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To have discovered this huge timber shipway was extraordinary.

auth_sentence.content: This week will witness an extraordinary juxtaposition of events.
auth_sentence.res_content: This week will witness an extraordinary juxtaposition of events.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This week will witness an extraordinary juxtaposition of events.

auth_sentence.content: It's important to understand how extraordinary this is.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's important to understand how extraordinary this is.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's important to understand how extraordinary this is.

stems_affixes.word_buile: co共同+ordin顺序+ate表动词,也表示形容词→顺序一样→同等的,引申为平等;协调
extra超+ordinary普通的→超出普通
in无+ordin命令,顺序+ate……的→无顺序的→过度的
in不+subordinate服从的→adj.不服从的,反抗的
ordin命令,顺序+al……的→adj.顺序的,依次的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 普通的,平凡的,平常的;平庸的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ordin命令,顺序+ary……的→有顺序的;听命令的→普通的
sub下面,副手+ordin顺序+ate……的→顺序在下→附属的
coordinate[v.协调 adj.同等的;座标]+or人→n.协调者,同等的人或物
ordin命令,顺序+ance表名词→命令[状态]→法令
co共同+ordin顺序+ate表动词,也表示形容词→顺序一样→同等的,引申为平等;协调
ordain=ordin命令,顺序→v.任命,命令
extra以外,超过+curriculum课程表→adj.课外的
extra以外,超过+aneous……的→从外面来的
extra以外,超过+ordinary普通的→超出普通
extra以外,超过+solar太阳的→adj.太阳系以外的
extra以外,超过+vag漫游,走+ant……的→走得过分→奢侈的
extra以外,超过+violet紫色的→adj.紫外线的
extra以外,超过+vert转→[性格]向外转→外向
extra以外,超过+vert转→[性格]向外转→外向
extra以外,超过+polate放→放到[事实]外→推断

Sentence.sentence: But most of all it was the extraordinary trajectory（轨迹）of his life.
Because so many of our modern technologies and services depend on oil, nations, corporations, and institutions that control the trade in oil exercise extraordinary power.
We learn from the passage that in today's world, whoever monopolizes the oil market will be able to exercise extraordinary power
It is almost impossible to imagine our society without thinking of the extraordinary achievements of scientists and engineers in building our complicated world.

means.word_mean: 意想不到的；令人惊奇的；奇怪的

sentences.en: It's extraordinary that he managed to sleep through the party.
sentences.cn: 真想不到他竟然从聚会开始一直睡到结束。

sentences.en: What an extraordinary thing to say!

means.word_mean: 不平常的；不一般的；非凡的；卓越的

sentences.en: She was a truly extraordinary woman.
sentences.cn: 他是位非常杰出的女性。

sentences.en: They went to extraordinary lengths to explain their behaviour.
sentences.cn: 他们竭力为自己的行为辩解。

means.word_mean: (指会议等：出于特别目的或正常之外偶然举行的）特别的；临时的（仅用于名词之前）

sentences.en: an extraordinary meeting was held to discuss the problem.
sentences.cn: 举行了特别会议讨论这个问题。

means.word_mean: (官员等，出于特别目的而雇用的）特派的；特命的

jushi.english: George has made extraordinary progress in his study of Chinese medicine.
jushi.chinese: 乔治在他的中医学习方面取得了惊人的进步。

jushi.english: I had an extraordinary dream last night.
jushi.chinese: 我昨夜做了个奇特的梦。

jushi.english: There will be an extraordinary meeting next Wednesday to discuss the emergency resolution.
jushi.chinese: 下星期三将有一个额外安排的会议专门讨论紧急决议。
